name: Baltimore Marriott Waterfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here overnight in November using a free night given to us by Marriott (we use points usually but each year they call to tell us we can stay overnight somewhere by a certain date). This hotel is so convenient to EVERYTHING! Fells Point, Little Italy, the Aquarium, and Inner Harbor are all easy walks. We were given a room with a view of the harbor on the 23rd floor. The only thing I will say as a "let down" was that when we arrived we were asked (we are Elite Members and it was our anniversary) what we would like to have brought to us as a "thank you" and we were told that we could use the Concierge Lounge for a free breakfast the next morning and to enjoy snacks and beverages and the view without a charge. We had half a bottle of Chardonnay with cheese and crackers brought to us (this was not expected but nice surprise)...BUT they only gave us one wine glass. Odd. And one set of silverware/napkin. We picked the time for delivery, and it was about thirty minutes later than that time. AND when we went to take pictures on the 31st floor in the Concierge Lounge, there was a sign stating that the lounge was closed for the rest of the weekend. We asked an employee and she stated that since the lounge was closed, we would be given complimentary room service for breakfast. We went downstairs to lobby to make the receptionist aware that it was closed and to ask her for breakfast voucher and were told that breakfast would be $29/person...not complimentary. So that was a let down. The lack of communication, but she was very sweet and gave us wonderful recommendations for dinner that night, etc. Our room had a comfortable king size bed (I love Marriott mattresses), a great view, was extremely clean and the only "plumbing issue" I noticed is that the sink "gurgles" when the water drained down it. There are two elevators depending on what floor you are on, there is another elevator to the parking garage if you don't park valet, there is a bar now (called Kozmos), two restaurants and a lovely lounge with fireplace. The one restaurant is casual and has a Starbucks as well as bakery, snacks, drinks and incidentals. The fifth floor deck off the pool was not open due to construction (so no pictures there either), but it will make a great lounging area in warm weather. For the views, the cleaniness and friendliness of staff and the location, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay and a fantastic location!

reviews.text: We surprised our daughter for her 5th birthday and decided to stay at the Baltimore Marriott for a couple of days. Best decision we could have made. As soon we got there to check in, three people came up to sing happy birthday to her. Then they upgraded our room for free, and when we went out to dinner that night they must have tried to sing happy b-day again because we got back there was a beautiful, obviously handmade cake with fondant icing and Happy Birthday written in chocolate around the plate. They even did it for her again the next morning at breakfast! Food was incredible--get the breakfast package--it's worth it. Food is a little pricey without it. The only possible things I could ding them for is no free wireless Internet access in the room--it's $12.95 per 24 hours, and the taxes are outrageous (23% per night) but I would think that is the case anywhere you stay in the city.
reviews.title: You definitely should stay here!

reviews.text: I would recommend the Marriott Waterfront without hesitation. Everyone we met was wonderful, kind and accommodating. They made us feel so special!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Views

reviews.text: We stayed in August 2011 for a family getaway. We were put in a corner room with wrap around windows - it was fabulous. You could see all of the inner harbour. The location puts you right in the middle of everything - easy walk to the aquarium, restaurants, science center, etc. Great for a family vacation!
reviews.title: Great Convention Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very well-managed convention hotel right on Baltimore's Inner Harbor. The staff was most attentive, and the rooms were very nice. I was upgraded to a large one-room suite with a great view since I am Marriott Rewards Silver level. The food was very good for a convention. The only complaint is that the hotel has an odd plumbing issue which results in loudly shaking pipes whenever one turns the hot water on past a certain level. Just kind of an annoyance. Overall, a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: We keep coming back

reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel. Location is on the water and the views are amazing. Rooms are large and beds are comfortable. Bathroom is large and updated. Extremely clean. I hosted a meeting for my workplace and i must say they did an excellent job. Staff was very attentive and helped make my meeting a huge success. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here recently for our anniversary. We purchased the aquarium package. Overall, the stay was very nice. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and in a great location, the staff overall was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was great. But we had a lot of little problems with our stay. We received expired tickets to the aquarium, so after walking over there and waiting in line we had to walk back to the hotel to request non-expired tickets and then wait in line a second time. Our package included parking, but when we went to validate our parking after arriving back at the hotel after dinner the front desk clerk refused to validate the parking. He actually argued with my husband about this. Then we discovered that our requested feather free room was not feather free (I am very allergic, but I guess this wasn't guaranteed, and we should have confirmed). All in all, one little annoyance after another. The package just didn't seem that well organized. To their credit, all of the problems were resolved quickly. It was just a bummer that they needed to be.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, A Few Little Issues

reviews.text: I stayed at this property for three nights last week as part of a large convention. Check-in at 9pm Tuesday evening was not the highlight of the week. Front desk reps were not knowledgeable about room locations and did not appear knowledgeable or proficient on the use of computers; the apparent desk manager was uninterested in assisting, even after a problem was apparent, and instead, opted for small talk. Throughout the week, there appeared also to be larger than normal lines at the front desk. Notwithstanding this complaint, I would definitely recommend the hotel, even for a large property. The hotel is located in a great area, with many restaurants and tourist sites close by. The employees of the hotel were all uninformly friendly, the rooms and the hotel itself were very clean and very well maintained, and for a convention style hotel, the food served at the hotel and in the conferences were surprisingly good. I would definitely stay here again, be it on business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Very Good Experience For A Large Hotel-One Exception

reviews.text: Great rooms and public spaces. Courteous staff and walkable jaunts to Fells Point and Inner Harbor. Free Internet for Marriotts Frequent Guest program members. Recommend you self park to save some cash. Great restaurants nearby. Near a water taxi stop.
reviews.title: One of the Best Large Hotels on the Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a weekend at the Baltimore Marriott. Since we have stayed there before, we were expecting excellent treatment. However, they far exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Perfection at its Finest

reviews.text: I stayed in Baltimore Marriott Waterfront during a conference held in the Baltimore Convention Center. I did not use any of the conference-recommended hotels, and instead, bit on priceline.com and got this hotel. Overall, I am very satisfied with my stay there. As the name suggests, it is right on the waterfront of Baltimore inner harbour. It takes about 20 minutes of brisk walk to get to the convention center, but the walk is pleasant, as you can take the path along the inner harbour and avoid walking along busy streets. One can also take the water taxi, but the first ride starts at 10am, too late for my conference.
reviews.title: A short walk to the convention center

reviews.text: The hotel food is nothing to write home about, and other amenities are pretty standard for Marriott. The Internet charge was $12.95/day. The only complain I have is that the charge is a 24-hour rate, but rather, is the noon-to-noon rate, which means, if you start the service in the evening (which was my case), your service would only last until noon the next day. The parking is expensive, so I parked a few blocks away on S. Caroline Street for $13/day (covered parking).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel...great location

reviews.text: Great hotel for a conference. The food was very good and the staff seemed to have their act together.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: A great home base for exploring Baltimore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Plentiful staff were very friendly. I'm extremely claustrophic and like to avoid elevators as much as possible. They gave me a room on the lowest available floor as requested when I made the hotel reservations.
reviews.title: Attractive hotel, good location

reviews.text: This is about my second stay at the hotel -- I've previously written a review on Tripadvisor based on my first stay. The room, the location, and almost everything else were the same as the first time, but there were two things different.
reviews.title: My second stay at the hotel -- disappointed at the service

reviews.text: The first thing different was that this time, I traveled with my family, including my 8-month-old daughter. I asked for a crib and the hotel did provide one, but it was one of those portable ones (like a playpen), not a proper crib. The top edges of this crib did not look clean. I had to wipe it with wet wipe thoroughly before putting my daughter in.
reviews.title: Great location to visit the harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second thing was about billing. I got the hotel by bidding on priceline.com. It turned out that Marriott charged my credit card instead of priceline.com (or in addition to charging priceline.com). I called them and they admitted that they made a mistake, but when I didn't get a refund on my credit card a month later, I had to call them again and it still didn't work. I had to call my own credit card company and lodge a formal dispute until I finally got the attention of Marriott. I am very disappointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful room overlooking Baltimore harbor

reviews.text: I stayed at the new Marriot for a business conference in September. The hotel is located on the Fells Point Sid elf the harbor and in walking distance to everything. The rooms are a nice size and views from the outdoor rooftop and 35th floor business suites are fabulous. I highly recommend staying in this location. There are great restaurants and sightseeing. It would be a great spot for a family event or putting. Even though I live only an hour from here, I plan on staying again.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: We only stayed at this hotel for one night, but the service was lovely and the view was gorgeous. We got a room overlooking the Baltimore Harbor. The room was very clean, the sheets were soft, and all-in-all it was a luxurious, fun experience for us. I recommend self parking in the garage across from the hotel -- it's less than half the price of the valet and it's barely a 2-minute walk.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I have just returned from a week at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront. The hotel is magnificent and I have experienced incredible. One of the best 5 Star Hotels in my experience.
reviews.title: Best Hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, great location! Overall, this hotel is fantastic: very friendly and efficient, clean, extremely well located and near to famous Aquarium..
reviews.title: Good business hotel that's also in a good tourist location.

reviews.text: Service everywhere was very professional as could be expected from a large chain hotel that caters to business travel as well as high-ish end vacationers.
reviews.title: Prime location in Inner Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The waterfront location is perfect for walking aroung to see sights, go to the many restaurants in the vacinity, or take a water taxi to see further sights in the bay.
reviews.title: We remember this Hotel with gratitude

reviews.text: The lobby level restaurant, bar, and lounge area are all great.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Luxurious for a Marriott

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in September and loved the Marriott Waterfront and we wished we could have stayed longer. I am a neat freak and have no complaintes about the room. Everything seemed very well maintained.
reviews.title: Amazing View

reviews.text: We got our hotel for $81.00 on Priceline and upgraded our room for $40.00 to an upper floor corner room that was amazing. It had two full walls of windows overlooking the inner harbor. I would suggest upgrading to a corner room if it is in your budget to do so.
reviews.title: Top of the line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was excellent and the location was great. We walked to Miss Shirleys for breakfast and it seemed within walking distants to most other attractions in the Inner Harbor. I would not suggest walking to either of the stadiums from this hotel. We took a taxi to the Oriels game and it was about $7.00 bucks including tip.
reviews.title: Amazing Getaway

reviews.text: Great hotel!
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is top of the line. It was very nice. Everyone was friendly and everything was clean. I would stay here time and time again. Very convient to shopping and Fell's point.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront is a great hotel!  I don't know what the other reviewers are complaining about.  My experience was exceptional from start to finish.  Upon check-in I asked for  a room upgrade sine I'm a Silver Elite rewards member.  I was given a beautiful corner room on a higher floor and the view of the harbor was magnificent!  The room was large, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom well equipped and large. I was here on business and on the 2nd day of my trip my wallet was stolen (with all my credit cards, cash, and identification inside) while shopping at a nearby store.  I immediately ran back to the Marriott and explained the situation.  The management was more helpful than I could have imagined, told me to charge whatever I needed to my room, and assured me I could settle my bill when I got my new credit card.   The security officer and hotel manager on duty could not have been more helpful, compassionate, and patient.  I was very stressed and they went out  of their way to help me call the police to report the theft.  They made sure I was notified and received my emergency cash and new credit card as soon as it arrived.  They checked in with me several times to make sure I was taken care of.  The only complaint that I had was that the internet service in my room never worked right despite a visit from the IT department.  The hotel rectified this though by giving me 500 Marriott reward points as compensation.  I have nothing but good things to say about my stay.  The Patty LaBelle concert  next to the hotel one evening was a definite plus!
reviews.title: Great location, service!

reviews.text: Once I found the entrance for parking I found this was an average Marriott; (as others have mentioned) parking is horrible.
reviews.title: Could be better, great views

reviews.text: Check-in was fine, nothing special - no instructions. Room was standard, bathroom was a little small; food was ok, staff could be friendlier, the conference rooms were cold, very cold.
reviews.title: Great time at Marriott Waterfront!

reviews.text: Booked a room at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront through Priceline for a quick getaway for my husband's birthday (we got a GREAT price!). We stayed for one night (1/3/09 to 1/4/09). Overall, I was very pleased with the quality of the room and the quality of service. Valet service was prompt and effortless. The staff was welcoming, polite and very professional. I called ahead of time to reserve a platter of chocolate-covered strawberries to be delivered to the room at a certain time, and it was there when we returned from dinner as asked! I asked for a room with a nice view, and we stayed in room 2443 - a corner room with an absolutely AWESOME view of the Inner Harbor. The room was very nice; very clean with contemporary decor. Room service came with breakfast within 15 minutes the next day. Checkout was quick and the bill was accurate. Overall, lovely hotel!
reviews.title: Valet Parking needs help

reviews.text: Terrible location when the hotel books two weddings at a time and wedding guests as well as the hotel guests need their cars valet parked. Driveway becomes backed up to the adjoining roads - especially on a Saturday night when all the restaurants in the area are also busy valet parking their cars. Never again! Manager agreed to a complimentary breakfast the following morning (as it took 90 minutes to get our car parked). When we checked out, however, we found we were charged for the breakfast. Rooms are pretty and clean, but our stay was way too aggravating for me ever to return.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: I just finished up a conference at the Waterfront, and was pleased with my stay. Aside from the hotel's strange and confusing layout, the rooms were clean (great view of the harbor), beds were comfortable, and the service was just fine. The room service breakfast arrived on time each morning and was fresh and hot.
reviews.title: Great Location, Decent Hotel

reviews.text: My only complaint is that there aren't any fans in the bathrooms. Weird.
reviews.title: $$$ Rate for a $ Room

reviews.text: I'd stay there again.
reviews.title: Remodeled an already great hotel

reviews.text: I just spent 4 nights here for a conference. Clearly they invested all their money in the lobby area, because my room was on a par with Hampton Inn, i.e., nothing wrong with it just not worth what Marriott is charging. I suggest you ask to see your room before commiting to staying here; WAY overpriced. If you're considering holding a conference or business here, they were not particularly helpful or cooperative, despite our organization spending $70,000 there. Location was good, food was good, staff other than the convention staff were friendly & helpful. The convention staff just didn't seem to much care; in today's economy, one would expect they would be overjoyed to have any business at all, certainly $70,000 worth...unfortunately, not so.
reviews.title: what a charm!!!!
Happy Hour in Kosmo's Lounge
reviews.text: I have stayed here once a year and was surprised to learn that they just remodeled their hotel which is amazing since the hotel was in really good condition. Outstanding Location for restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. Concierge Lounge is the best the Marriott Chain has to offer. Beds were comfortable, Flat screen, Coffee Maker, good size bathroom and good lighting. Nice views of the harbor. Everything clean and fresh.

description: This Maryland hotel offers a unique location for business meetings, events, and weddings with state of the art meeting space and a Grand Ballroom - the largest meeting room in Baltimore.
